instructions: Tap the Track Controls button Track Controls button , then tap Track Settings. On iPhone 8, iPhone 7, or iPhone 6s, tap the Settings button Settings button in the control bar, tap Track Controls, then tap Track Settings. Tap Velocity Sensitivity, then tap the sensitivity level you want to use for the keyboard.

Hold your iPhone 10 20 inches (25 50 cm) away from your face and tap the Face Control button Face Control button . The first time you use Face Control, GarageBand asks for permission to access the camera on your iPhone. As you play, open and close your mouth to change the sound. To turn Face Control off, tap the Face Control button again.
Close GarageBand. Open the Settings app, scroll down, then tap GarageBand. Tap Keyboard Note Labels.

Tap the Controls button Controls button , turn the Autoplay knob to one of the numbered positions, then tap the Controls button again. Tap a segment of one of the chord strips. The upper segments (showing the chord names) play chords and bass notes together. The middle segments play chords only. Tapping with two or three fingers plays variations of the pattern. The lower segments play bass notes only. To access the full chord strip, tap the Controls button Controls button again. Tap the segment again to stop playing the pattern.

Modify an existing keyboard sound by adjusting the keyboard controls. Tap the Navigation button Navigation button in the control bar, tap the Sounds button, then tap Save. Type a name for your custom sound, then tap Done. The first time you save a custom sound, a new Custom category appears. You can rename or delete the sound by tapping Edit, then tapping the icon (to rename the sound) or the red circle (to delete the sound).
